segments.label: code_analysis

segments.text: In Joda-Time, LocalDate has a method called plusDays(int days) which adds the specified number of days. So to add 5 days, they should call currentDate.plusDays(5). That makes sense.
segments.label: code_analysis

segments.text: Let me check if there's any other way, but I think that's the straightforward method. So the correct code should be currentDate.plusDays(5). Yeah, that's right.
segments.label: bug_fixing

segments.text: The plusDays method returns a new LocalDate instance with the days added, which is exactly what they need for datePlusDays.
segments.label: code_analysis
